results.title: Think big
results.creator_credit: Susan Doring, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about the place of work in people’s lives. To be really successful one needs determination and hard work. Many executives put work before the family causing conflicts, but a choice has to be made. Two executives, a man and a married woman discuss their jobs.

results.title: Screaming red
results.brief_description: WINNER: Diegesis Festival 2003. This well scripted story is painfully easy to relate to with strong character development and use of sound that shows the assurance of a seasoned short filmmaker. Ruthanne describes her film as “A metaphysical journey of the heart, revealing layers of the teenage psyche.”

results.title: The One that got away
results.creator_credit: Gillian Coote, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about attitudes to work. School teacher, Lowell decided to give up teaching, get away from the hassles of living and working in the city and become a fisherman. He and his family enjoy living in the peaceful bush in a cottage with few modern amenities. His parents on the other hand cannot understand his attitude. Photographed by Paul Tait, edited by Lana Bennett, sound by Rowland McManus.

results.title: I give my heart
results.creator_credit: Gillian Coote, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
Tells the story of Ulla, a volunteer worker for the Laotian refugees coming into Australia. Ulla, having experienced growing up under Hitler, is committed to helping humanity. She works about ten to twelve hours a day but still doesn’t have enough time to finish her work. She is hopeful of forthecoming government assistance.

results.title: For love or money
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about attitudes to work. Deals with the satisfaction one feels when working for yourself, doing something you really enjoy, even if the money is not as much as working for an employer. A commercial artist, sign-writer and a mechanic present their viewpoints.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Ramsey, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
